cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi WSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the north-western Caribbean, crossing western Cuba Friday, then moving through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi) Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Buras / New Orleans area)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches may be required later for northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet for U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Alabama, with highest risk along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (port is well upriver, surge heights expected to diminish before reaching Baton Rouge)
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (63%) of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds; up to 30% chance of 50-kt (58-mph) winds as the core moves inland Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant at the port itself, but lower Mississippi River levels could rise slightly due to back-water effects.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10+ inches of rain possible, producing flash flooding and river rise in the Baton Rouge area Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for prolonged power outages, roadway closures, and interruption of barge traffic on the Mississippi River.
